definition: to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: The paper discusses the technology of long-range air-to-air missile attacking by two cooperative fighters.
sentences.chinese: 探讨了双机合作条件下远程空空导弹的攻击技术。

sentences.english: Finally, the new development features of air-to-air missiles in 2009 are summarized.
sentences.chinese: 最后，总结了2009年空空导弹研制出现的新特点。

sentences.english: A group of complex differential equations must be solved for the ballistic calculation of air-to-air missile.
sentences.chinese: 空空导弹弹道计算需要解算一组复杂的微分方程。

sentences.english: The realization to launch air-to-air missile backward is studied.
sentences.chinese: 讨论了空空导弹后射的工程实现问题。

sentences.english: An guidance law of agile turn of air to air missile in off-borsight launching is discussed.
sentences.chinese: 讨论了空空导弹在大离轴角发射时的快速转弯控制律。

sentences.english: The result shows it is possible to launch air-to-air missile backward.
sentences.chinese: 结果阐明，实现空空导弹后射是可能的。

definition: early warning aircraft system, e.g. US AWACS
opportunity in a battle/fighter aircraft/war secret
anti-missile missile (such as the Patriot Missile)
